title: Primary school bans all drinks except water from children's packed lunches
text:

Parents are in "uproar" after a primary school banned all drinks except water.

One mum has expressed her fury after the policy was put in place, meaning children can only have water in their packed lunches, unless an alternative is supplied by the school themselves.

She says that both she and others are extremely unhappy with the decision, saying: "half the parents want to take their kid out of the school as a result."

But the headteacher of St Andrew's Primary School in Bransholme, Kingston upon Hull, said that the water-only policy had already been in place in the classrooms for the last 15 years and was simply being extended amid concerns over children with allergies and the consumption of sugary drinks .

Hull Daily Mail reports that Graham Huckstep, the school's head, said he had received just three negative emails about the policy, out of a school with 600 pupils and that two parents had been into the school itself to discuss the policy further.

But the feelings are running high among some parents, and there is a plan to set up a petition after suggestions that teachers "smell" the children's drinks to ensure they contain nothing other than water.

(Image: hulldailymail.co.uk)

One mum said: "Our kid's headteacher at primary has now not only issued a ban on juice during the day but now only water with kids' packed lunches due to allergies and dairy allergies.

"He won't put the allergy sufferers in a different room saying it's penalising them but it's also penalising the children without allergies. Serves what they want in the dinner hall with glasses of milk, so why is packed lunch different?

"There is absolute uproar about it.

"It's not nice to have a child with allergies but instead of upsetting everyone, and like he says it's life-threatening, he needs to make sure the kids who have these life-threatening allergies are in their own safe area to eat what they want.

"We as parents are absolutely enraged. We give our children school compliant juices for their dinners as a lot of our children don't like water.

"It's like we are back at school ourselves, there's always some daft rule in place."

(Image: Getty Images)

Parents have been told the new rule will come into play after October half-term.

The mum added: "Teachers also unscrew children's water bottles and smell the water to make sure there's no other sort of drinks been given.

"We got a newsletter last night saying that after half term, all children who are packed lunch will only be allowed water with their dinners due to various allergies.

"The school canteen serves milk, dairy products etc. It's like our children are being penalised because of other kids' allergies.

"People in restaurants aren't told to only drink water because there's an allergy sufferer in the restaurant. What if you're walking past someone eating a Snickers for example? Life can't be stopped for everyone."

In a statement of response to parents' concerns, Mr Huckstep said: "St Andrew's like most schools are developing our 'Healthy Bodies/Healthy Minds' approach.

(Image: hulldailymail.co.uk)

"Reducing sugary drinks and improving attitudes towards healthy bodies is a national project, as you are aware.

"Linked with this is our care of those growing number of children with allergies.

"Our water policy - instigated on an idea by parents - was initiated 15 years ago."

Mr Huckstep also added that the school has alternative provisions for children who cannot drink water for medical reasons and said he's received messages of support from parents since announcing the extension to the policy.
description: Headteacher has said pupils bringing in packed lunches won't be allowed any other kinds of drinks with their food
